noun.description: A thermodynamic quantity representing the unavailability of a system's thermal energy for conversion into mechanical work, often interpreted as the degree of disorder or randomness in the system.
Lack of order or predictability; gradual decline into disorder.
examples: a marketplace where entropy reigns supreme

noun.description: (in information theory) a logarithmic measure of the rate of transfer of information in a particular message or language.

origin: Mid 19th century: from en- inside + Greek tropē transformation.
